alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 3:36PM PST until March 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Russian River near Hopland affecting Mendocino County. For the Russian River...including Hopland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Russian River near Hopland. * WHEN...From late tonight to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding of Highway 175 is expected at the approaches to the Russian River bridge. Expect flooding of cropland on the right bank of river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM PST Thursday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tonight to 15.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning to 8.4 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage again early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.6 feet on 03/28/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 345 AM PST.
